#Text=Iran 's Ahmadinejad wants change in US policies , not ' tactics '
#Text=Thursday , January 29 , 2009
#Text=Ahmadinejad said he would welcome change from the US , but only a " fundamental and effective change . "

column1: #Text=Image : Daniella Zalcman .
#Text=Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad called on the United States to substantially change its foreign policy toward Iran in an address aimed at the new Barack Obama administration .
#Text=In addition to urging a new direction in foreign policy , Ahmadinejad demanded that the US apologize for the " crimes they have committed against the Iranian nation " over the past 60 years .

column1: #Text=Ahmadinejad says these " dark crimes " include the economic sanctions imposed since the country 's 1979 revolution , attempts to halt Iran 's nuclear program , and America 's support of Israel .

#Text= Mr. Bush has gone into the trash can of history with a very black and shameful file full of treachery and killings , " Ahmadinejad was quoted as saying .

column1: #Text=" He left and , God willing , he will go to hell . "
#Text=The remarks came a day after President Obama made a much-publicized appearance on Al Arabiya , an Arabic news channel .
#Text=During the interview , Obama repeated a theme from his inauguration speech , saying " if countries like Iran are willing to unclench their fist , they will find an extended hand from us " .
#Text=Diplomacy will be a very important tool in US relations with Iran , he clarified .
#Text=It is not clear if Ahmadinejad 's speech was meant as a response to Obama 's interview , but some of his remarks seemed to echo Obama 's campaign theme of " change " .

column1: #Text=Ahmadinejad said there are two types of change he could expect from Washington .
#Text=" First is a fundamental and effective change , " he said .
#Text=" The second ... is a change of tactics . "
#Text=He said Iran would welcome change from the US , but only if it were " truly serious and basic " .
#Text=If someone wants to talk with us in the language that Bush used , even if he uses new words , our response will be the same that we gave to Bush during the past years . — Mahmoud Ahmadinejad
#Text=Ahmadinejad offered his own definition of change .
#Text=" Change means giving up support for the rootless , uncivilized , fabricated , murdering ... Zionists and let the Palestinian nation decide its own destiny , " he was quoted as saying .
#Text=" Change means putting an end to U.S. military presence in the world . "
#Text=He said Iran will be " waiting patiently " and carefully studying the new administration 's actions to see if such change takes place .
#Text=HAVE YOUR SAY
#Text=Do you think that President Obama 's is engaging Iran diplomatically ?
#Text=What do you think of President Ahmadinejad 's response ?
#Text=Add or view comments
#Text=Obama campaigned on a promise to introduce diplomacy into US-Iranian relations , but it remains to be seen if either side will be willing to engage in diplomacy .
#Text=Other US officials seemed to reflect a more conciliatory tone towards Iran than the previous administration .
#Text=Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton said Tuesday that Iran has a " clear opportunity " to engage with the international community .
#Text=US ambassador to the United Nations Susan Rice pledged " direct " support to Iran only if it halts its controversial nuclear program , which Iran insists is for peaceful energy purposes .

#Text=Even if Ahmadinejad is willing to talk with the US , any decision on foreign relations will require the approval of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei , Iran 's Supreme Leader , who said in October that hatred of America runs deep in Iran .
#Text=However , opposition politician Ebrahim Yazdi is somewhat optimistic regarding the prospect of diplomacy , believing better ties with the US are in Iran 's economic and political interest .
#Text=" The political atmosphere in Iran is now ripe , is suitable for direct negotiation with the United States , " he said .
